title: Ticket #5041: Blahp should check for empty job id from qsub
description:
We've observed cases where PBS/Torque's qsub command returns 0 but doesn't provide a job id. Currently, the blahp treats this as a successful job submission. It should treat it as a failed submission attempt.

We can add something like the following to the blahp's pbs_submit.sh: 

if [ "X$jobID" == "X" ]; then
    rm -f $bls_tmp_file
    echo "Error: job id missing" >&2
    echo Error # for the sake of waiting fgets in blahpd
    exit 1
fi
